newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine cash maize down in good volume.
newsitem.headline: Argentine cash maize down in good volume.

text.p: Argentine cash maize was steady to lower in good volume trade at the Buenos Aires Cereals Exchange, as farmers rushed to sell off their plentiful harvest, traders said.

The FAS elevator maize price for delivery to Buenos Aires fell $2 to $106. Soybean prices held steady in moderate volume, with crushers looking to buy to lock in margins for recent forward oil sales to destinations including China and Iran. Rosario spot soybeans were at $293. Wheat slipped $2 to $154 Quequen in good volume trade, with exporters reselling to local millers. Rosario sunseed was steady at $226.
